transcript.content: Elbow, alright? Fallen Angel, on XFM 104.9. Well we're back. I'm Ricky Gervais and with me Stephen Merchant and Karl Pilkington. Karl's all, a little bit, I don't know he's a bit frustrated. He's sort of a bit sweaty and fed up today, aren't ya? Because of the heat.
It's too much though innit?
He was taking it out... he was sort of... he wanted a fight. You know he doesn't usually like to fight. I sort of like lean on him and rub his head.
Yeah.
But today he was sort of leading it. It was sort of like getting a little bit... if I didn't know anything better I'd say it was sexual frustration.
Well I was watching Rick, if you don't mind me saying, I was watching, not in the that way...
He was saying "I want to hit you" and I was thinking "does he want to hit me or does he want to do something else to me"
Exactly.
What are your thoughts Karl?
Exactly.
I mean, I saw him sort of wrestling with you on the floor and you clearly weren't enjoying it. But he was really loving it.
Yeah, what was going on? What's the change? Why are you suddenly sort of...
What are you trying to say?
No, I'm not. I'm just saying it was weird that you were suddenly... it was like you were... ooh... don't know...
You saying that I'm a bit gay?
No.
Is that what you're saying?
No, but what was...
Suzanne accused me of that in the week.
Why?
For being a bit gay. She said "I'm sure you're gay".
Why?
Just because I was moaning about stuff, she said "oh you're a drama queen".
Right, well that's...
What were you moaning about, not having enough gay sex?
Just...
That she didn't have a knob. He's going "Why don't you get yourself a nice little knob?". Can I call you Frank?
Could you wear this false beard?
Yeah, yeah.
It was just, erm, well we'll talk about it later, it was about the Seven Wonders, I just wasn't that impressed.
He wasn't impressed... he said... well we'll save it. We got a top show coming up haven't we?
But if you are a little bit, kind of, just a little bit sexually, you know, don't be afraid to let it out. I mean if you want us to relieve you of it.
I tell you what, let's have a little bit of Maggie May by Rod.
Can't we play Killing Of Georgie?
Erm, that's your favorite song isn't it? That's weird, isn't it?
Strange.
That's weird. I'd like to hear Rod Stewart singing about a lovely lady, please Karl.
As would I. You can picture whomever you want.
Bit of Rod. Maggie Mae on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. Steve.
Well, I've only just read about this and I'm quite... I don't know anything about it, this naked rambler, Steve Gough.
Yeah.
Is he doing some kind of walk from Land's End to John o'Groats, is he completely nude?
Yeah, he's been arrested ten times on the way, apparently.

Right. It says here that Nora Gough, his mum, she's in her 70s, she's begged her son not to walk naked from Land's End to John o'Groats. She says, "I don't know where he gets this from, certainly not me. I am and have always been quite conservative. He would never have been allowed to walk around the house without covering himself up. I won't go as far as to say I'm ashamed of him, but I do not approve of what he is doing. Having said that it's good to see him on the telly."
Yeah, yeah. It's slightly embarrassing until their famous for it. However embarrasing it is.
I can't believe my son's a serial killer, nice to see him on the telly.
He looks like one, he's not, obviously, you know. I mean, Steve wouldn't say he was, he's just a rambler.
What's his motivation?
Don't know, he's just a nudist I suppose. There's a picture in there. Karl looked at it and went "Urgh, what's the point in that?". He went, "Well look at him, he's got shoes and socks on.".
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
That can only be- either they got the idea from something like Carry On Camping, or Benny Hill.
Or they actually like it jiggling around as much as possible.
Yeah.
But is that safe?
Well, I assume so. You play volleyball with trousers on, don't ya? I wouldn't have thought-
Yeah, but there's a bit of su- like, support there.
Ricky snickers
I mean, I was watching, um, athletics, right? The other week.
Yeah.
And, uh, I was watching it 'cause there's a lad who- who I went to school with - he's like, winning gold medals and everything there in the Olympics and stuff.
Right, right.
So I was looking out for him. Uh...
Now, if you went to school with him I'm assuming he's got three legs or something?
No, no, he's normal.
He's just a regular guy?
He used to push me on, uh, on me gokart and that, so I feel like I've-
You've trained him.
I was there from the start, training him up a bit.
Yeah.
And, uh, watching the program. And there was swimming in it.
And, uh, I was watching that for a bit, gettin' a bit annoyed 'cause...
But- that butterfly stroke.
Yeah.
I don't- I don't know why they do that.
No, nor do I.
It's just hard work, it doesn't make you go any faster than the- say the, that stroke.
The front crawl.
Yeah, don't do that "that stroke" on radio it doesn't work - the crawl, yeah.
So, uh, I was watching that thinking "oh, that's annoying."
Yeah.
And then they got onto the running bit, and, uh, me mate's in this race.
Yeah.
Now, they do the side shot, don't they? So you can see who's in the lead.
Sure.
And then they do that front shot, where it's absolutely pointless
The only reason to do the front shot I- I think, is to keep women interested.
Steve laughs
Because you can basically see... his tackle, goin' from left to right - being battered all over the place.
Ricky and Steve laugh
Why were you looking?!
Seriously, you had no choice.
If you wanted to watch it, it was like- I was interested if he was gonna win. But it's like, you know.
But why didn't you turn over and watch Charlie's Angels instead?
Because I wanted to see if he won the race!
Well, flip back at the end.
Just flip back to get the results.
Well...
Or at least turn away or close your eyes from the front shot.
No, I wasn't- I just- Suzanne was happy, Suzanne was loving it.
Yeah.
And I was like "whoa whoa whoa!"
Yeah.
Just go to the other shot - but they were showing you the front shot, and running along there.
They could've just shown the top half, but they didn't.
Sure.
It was there-
Just heads moving along at 25 miles an hour! Yeah.
I think you're meant to see the running, the actual legs moving.
It is an athletics coverage, isn't it?
But they don't show you a shot from behind.
Did you want that?
...and I didn't want that either.
Ricky laughs
It sounds like you were disappointed!
Yeah, play a record.
What are we havin'? A bit of Radiohead?
Yeah, be brilliant wouldn't it?
Yeah.
Incidentally, last week you remember we began the show by talking about knobs.
Yeah.
I think we've got a bit more knob news this week.
Knob news comin' up is it?
Knob news is on the way.
After Radiohead: more cock.
Steve laughs
Radiohead - Go To Sleep

Radiohead and "Go To Sleep" - that's not to you, please don't go to sleep, we've got another hour and thirty five minutes of fun chat and great, great music on XFM 104.9 - I'm Ricky Gervais with me Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington.
Pilky, K-man Pilkers, little baldie twat manc whinging- a little bit bent Pilkers.
Steve laughs
There he is.
There he is there.
Now, Rick, you may remember that last week we opened with, um, some quality, uh, knob news.
Knob news, yeah.
It was, uh, it was, um-
Hitler's knob.
Hitler's knob was one of them - that just- that just sparked off into a whole bunch of other kind of knob related discussions.
Yeah.
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
Must've been... 75?
Okay.
Walks past.
Shoes, socks.
Sort of, shorts, but because he's old I don't think he's got like a normal pair of shorts - they were like suit pants, but short.
Right.
Really smart shorts that I've never seen before.
Yeah.
But the thing is - with him being old and thin...
Yeah.
It's just- don't do that, don't walk around like that.
What, the legs?
The legs and the back - he looked like a little tortoise without its shell on.
Ricky laughs
I'd love to see- I've always wanted to see a tortoise without its shell on!
Yeah.
Just to see if it would run really fast and go "this is brilliant!"
Just scamper along!
I saw a grotesque thing. I saw - and I think it's Britain's fattest man, I'm not sure.
Oh...
He was huge - I mean, I don't wish him any ill. But so big, it was ludicrous - he was waddling down, um, Oxford Street.
And, he was- I mean genuinely - you know I'm not a big fan of ginormous people, Rik Waller for instance.
Yea.
Turns my stomach.
Ricky lets out a stifled laugh
This guy was twice as big. He was extraordinary.
And he sat down on a big bench, and literally took up the whole space.
And he reached into his bag - he was having his lunch - and he was eating an apple.
Ricky snickers
And I really felt like- I wanted to slap him on the back and go "it's a bit late for that, mate!"
Well, it's- he's probably starting now- he's probably starting thinking, like, "I'm gonna make a change" and imagine if you'd have said that.
Yeah.
And he'd have- it'd have been awful, wouldn't it?
Yeah. He took- he cut it in half, put it between two slices of chocolate.
Ricky laughs
I mean, I don't know how you get that big.
And waited for a pig to come past, shoved it in his mouth-
Exactly!
Swallowed it whole! Ah...
I don't know how he gets that big. And it was like- he'd come out to sort of, soak up some of the sun. You know.
Well, you look better with a tan.
Steve laughs
I suppose so.
Yeah.
Yeah.
Was he wearing loose black clothes?
He was, of course he was loose black clothes!
That works up to a point!
Yeah.
And then, you know, it's not fooling anyone.
Is it vertical stripes?
Yeah.
To make you look thinner.
Just people walking past thinking it's night.
Yeah. Yeah, exactly.
Ricky laughs
So, Karl.
So yeah, so that's- you know, that's been annoying me with the weather and that.
Yeah.
And then, uh-
I love the warm weather.
No...
Although I can't sleep at night, I had two hours in front- just, went and laid down in front of the window. In front of the french window, just because it was just too hot last night.
But if I could sleep - I love the hot weather, I love walking around when it's sunny. It's better for you, people are usually happier in hot weather.
The sun is good for ya. I mean it has been hot - I mean it's a hundred degrees, it's probably too hot to work, but...
Mental, I can't- I can't think straight and stuff.
You know, your little baldie head, isn't it bad for it? 'cause it just- doesn't it make your brain a little bit hot?
Well, I mean I've just got me head on show, what about the nudists?
Ricky laughs
Worry about them before you worry about me! Alright?
Another thing that happened in the week, um, you know, I've just had builders 'round, sorting the kitchen out.
Yeah.
Sure.
Uh, so, virtually skint. But another problem happens.
Boiler. Starts playing up.
Right.
Right?
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
Uhh, Bruce Almighty.
Sure.
Why?!
Just something to see, isn't it?
Yeah. So you were you were trying to sneak in the back?

So on the way - cutting across Leicester Square - and those fellows who sell roses it comes over "do you want one? do you want one?", I said "don't do that. She's allergic to them." Right? So so it go away.
Yeah.
She got all annoyed about that.
Because she's not allergic to them?
Well, she's not allergic, no. But they're about three quid each!
Ricky and steve laugh
The point of that Karl, is not that she really wants a rose - it's that you're willing to spend three pounds on her.
Taking us to the pictures!
(laughing) How much was that? That was eight quid each. Did you pay for it though?
If I know you, you had a dressed up as a small child.
Yeah!
Me and my son, please!
Or you made her sit on your shoulder as wear a long coat.
Yeah. Exactly.
Anyway, listen, songs are phrase then.
You paid for her to go in and then you went and had a pint while she watched it.
Yeah, there's no point both of us seeing it, but tell me about it.
Tell me what it's like.
Galileo! Don't talk to me about science, make me television!
Oh right. Songs of Phrase then.
So let's explain what Songs of Phrase is.
You do it.
Okay.
Really? if you think that karl is bored with life, then you will be even more bored once you've heard this particular quiz. The gist of it is that karl has taken a well-known phrase while saying...
Well, I'll stop you there. Not a well known phrase. Something that HE said once.
On this show.
Yeah, probably.
And he's somehow comp... compiled together a number of different songs, which have somehow built up that particular phrase or sentence
Umm if it's anything about Chinese people Philip Bailey will be involved. That's all I can say.
Okay, let's hear it then karl.
Galileo! Don't talk to me about SCIENCE! Pleeeeeaassee make me tele-vision.
All right.
Right! I don't know what that is.
I don't know what that was. This is appalling.
I don't know what that is! karl! KARL! I do not know what that is! What is the phrase?!
I just was saying last week about everyone's raving about Galileo.
No! They're not! No. No. They're Not.
That sounds like a sort of B-side from The Buggles.
No. Everyone's raving about Beyonce and Robbie Williams. They're not...
And Pop Idol...
They're not. People going. "What are you in to?" - "Galileo's good!".
Yeah.
Forget it. Forget it.
No!
Xfm outro plays.
Placebo - Special Needs
Placebo, song for Karl there. That's Special needs on Xfm 104.9 - I'm Ricky Gervais with me Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington.
We were doing songs of phrase.
Oh, yeah, I forgot about that. Oh God. So what is this phrase? What is the phase karl?!
Last week? We were talking about Galileo.
Right?
And I just was saying - years ago, and I can't remember now. When was it? When was he doing his thing?
End of the 16th century I think.
Right, and he was messing about trying to find out about... speed of light something?
No, he did lots of did lots of stuff, Galileo.
All I was saying is.
Gravity.
Back then, sure, everyone was saying - stop messing with that, make us a tele. You what what I mean - there was other things that people would have been happier with.
Sure
Back then.
Yeah, so the phrase exactly is what? The well-known phrase is what?
Errr, Galileo... err...
Oh it goes like this doesn't it?
Ricky laughs.
Song of phrase starts playing - "...SCIENCE... Pleeeeeasssse... make me... TELEVISION".
So it's Galileo. Stop...
Talking to me about science make me television?
Make me television.
Yeah, so you email in with the bands and that.
Brilliant.
Well.
That is Rock Bottom. The well known phrase...
Steve laughs.

"Galileo please stop talking to me about science, make me television". As a well-known phrase is the one of the weirdest things I've ever... forget jizz out of windows and things like that. That is the weirdest thing. I've heard on radio as a competition
Can we have hat one next week?
Ricky laughs.
Umm, ok Here are the prices if you think, Rick, you think the quiz has hit rock bottom. Wait till I tell you thee prizes.
Aww, brilliant!
Erm...
We're very much pushing new music on Xfm and it's an alternative music station.
Ehhhyeah
So you'll be pleased that we're giving away "Now That's What I Call Music: 55" featuring the likes of Busted and Daniel Bedingfield.
Brilliant.
You really know how to cater to our audience, don't you? The best dance album in the world that includes DJ Sammy, Scooter and Liberty X. Look forward to that.
Yep.
This is not so bad Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds a live DVD of a *coughs* pardon me, of a performance at *coughs* pardon me again, AHEM!
Steve starts coughing in the background.
Cough!
*cough* AHHH OH EH EH that basically sums up the prizes. So I won't tell you the rest are all monotonous. But anyway, *coughs* I think those crisps, Rick, have gone down the wrong way
Ricky starts laughing
Or although I was eating goulash earlier. Sorry, I'm fine, I'm fine, I'm fine. So anyway, yeah, that's that's some of the prizes, and you can win some tat.
So...
You can identify these artists.
The well-known phrase "Galileo stop talking to me about science, make me television".
So just email in.
It's appalling...
But easy this week, I think. Yeah. Play a record karl. I mean, it's ridiculous.
Ricky dot gervais at XFM dot CO dot UK. The Pixies...
The Pixies - Holiday Song
The Pixies on Xfm. 104.9 Holiday Song.
You're talking about people coming around and just bang in the boiler and charging 90 quid I think was last Christmas.

We had a dripping tap, right, and it started off just dripping a little bit and then after a coup... I thought - you know - we'll get that sorted out. We couldn't actually turn the tap. Couldn't it was just solid where the... Where the the washer gone and then over Christmas like a couple of days before Christmas. It just started flowing. It was just like on and I think this is terrible.... terrible waste. It was the hot tap and cause everything....
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
Yeah.
How much did he charge you? Ninety quid?
It's just under ninety quid.
Yeah, yeah.
And all he said was, you know, "give it a bang". If you don't work again, give it a bang.
What does that mean? that there's an airblock and they just like... what?
I don't know.

It's not that complicated is it, you wouldn't think a boiler is that complicated. It's not like understanding, you know, how fast breeder (?) works or a computer. It's a big lump of metal with how water it it. How... how can we not know that... we're discussing me and Glyn trying to work out how a fridge works.
Right.
Pretty cool.
Magic?
It is the magic comes down the electricals, into the frozen peas.
(laughing) That's what I thought. Yeah.

Yeah. cantstillcantsortof. I know it's something to do with the hydro fluorocarbons are, can exist at much lower temperatures without freezing. So when they enter the fridge sort of, under pressure... as they flow round, because they're in... the pressure goes down. They take energy from the... a... play a record!
It's perhaps a discussion to have in the pub and not on the air!
Play a record. play a record, karl.
I still can't figure out, I've never quite understood how a plane stays in the air.
It always unnerves me when I'm in a plane.
Turning a tap on, getting water.
Ricky laughs
Basically (inaudible) karl goes walking.
Yeah, Yeah.
Here's a bit of science for you.
Go on...
Right, erm... read the other day.
Yeah.
If you dug a big hole, right, say in - wherever - Trafalgar Square. Right.
Yep.
You dig a big hole, and you keep digging, and you go right through the Earth.
Right...
Out to the other side.
Yeah.
So you're somewhere in Australia or something, right?
Yeah.
And then you go back to come back again. Come back to London right stand next to the whole jump in it. Apparently you can jump through the world in 42 minutes.
Steve laughs.
It's interesting!
But then I was thinking will you fall and then when you come out the other end, would you fall back again?
Well, yeah, you would wouldn't you?
What would happen is, you'd accelerate err, 10 meters per second, per second to the Center of the Earth.
Mumbling

But you have such inertia you'd nearly go as far out the other end before it was like a bungee jump, so you'd nearly get as far as the other end. And then you'd go back again and you keep going until back and forth getting getting further and further away from making it - until you went "dududududu" sort of back-and-forth in the center.
Then you stay still in the center.

Have you drilled a hole through the Earth? Get in touch email xfm.co.uk and just let us know how you got on. Did you get to the other side? Did you get to Australia? Did you buy one of those funny cork hats still see Paul Hogan?
How does a fish work?
Darkness - Growing on Me
Darkness growing on me Xfm 104.9 I'm Ricky Gervais with me Stephen Merchant and Karl Pilkington. I bored karl, lost him didn't I in a little conversation.
Yeah, you're talking about quantum physics to be fair.
Yeah. I was explaining what a black hole was because we we're talking about that as well last night and just halfway through he just went "yeah, yeah yeah"
Put his headphones on.
Yeah (laughing) brilliant.
Yeah, cause he speaks with such Authority about things that he thinks he knows about...

... to stay on the air then you need to petition Karl, giving good reasons why he should stay; why this show isn't boring, or rather why he shouldn't be bored by it. I mean, you're bound to be bored as listeners, but obviously, uh... he's running out of steam now.
Why do you... what are you fed up with? You're just fed up with... in general, are you? Having your... want your Saturdays back, do you?
Just want a bit of a life back, that's all.
But...
But you don't do anything with your life when you've got it.
Why don't you... why don't you do this instead of, like, your day job?
Can't. It's more important than my day job, innit. That's what earns the company money and that. Know what I mean?
Well...
So...
Why don't you do... why don't you do a regular show then? Sack someone who's, you know, quite frankly not pulling their weight...
Don't want to. Been there, done that. I did that years ago. Done it. Done it.
What do you mean?
Told you, I've done a lot of stuff. Boxing - done, tick. Dancing - done.
No, you turned up, the place was shut.

Yeah, but...
Dancing? When did you do dancing?
That's when he... when he went and said "oh, I want to do dancing", and he went along to the place and it was shut, and that was it. And he said "I didn't do it anymore". That's not doing it, is it?
Steve laughs
Boxing - he had a fight with one lad...
... then another lad beat him up and he didn't go again.
Oh dear, it's pathetic. Well anyway, yeah, so this is basically our penultimate show. Next week's the final and we're all looking forward to that enormously.
Yeah.
But that may be it forever then and this... this... you know... all for one... you know, one for all, all for one. The Three Musketeers. Gone. Forever.
Yeah.
I for one'll be pleased.
Ricky laughs
Oh... I'll have to get some of these taped, 'cause I like coming in and sort of um... you know...
Incidentally, Rick, don't be afraid to nick as many CDs as you see fit on that last show.
People have already nicked them.
No, I know.
I mean...
But just take whatever you what.
Is that 4 Non Blondes is still there, innit?
I think it's still there.
'Cause I don't want that to be nicked.
Yeah. And I got a feeling, um... there's... 'cause I don't think there's any Smiths in the library but there is quite a lot of Gina G.
Really?
Karl sighs
What? What was that sigh for?
Nothing...
Nothing, nothing...
What?
Knocking on desk
Ooh... do you wanna...
Play a record. Monkey News is on the way, plus the results...
This isn't radio! Keep... you've gotta keep talking or playing music!
Play some music?
Yeah!
Ricky laughs
Neil Young - Heart of Gold
Heart of Gold by Neil Young on XFM 104.9.
Um... Pop Idol, of course, begins this evening. I know you're looking forward to it, Rick.
Yeah, love it, love it.
It's always a joy, isn't it? Especially those early rounds with the, uh... the divs.
The mentals. Yeah.
Steve laughs
Yeah, they are always extraordinary. That's the only reason I watch. I mean...
... I can't be bothered with the later contest. It's just watching the freaks for the first couple of weeks.
Uh...
It's an absolute pleasure.
Yeah, I sort of like watching the judges, they're good as well.
Oh, the judges are good, yeah. Yeah.
I like the fact they've got their little shtick, you know... the special jokes they've obviously written... just waiting to get them in.
Yeah. Yeah.
It's great.
But, um...
I like when Pete Waterman cries as well.
Does he cry?
Sometimes, if he's moved by it. "He's better than bloody Bobby Darin!"
Steve laughs
Like it, yeah. Yeah. Rosie Ribbon made him cry... He just...
... wells up and then...
Ricky imitates holding back tears
... like that. That's good, I like that. Yeah.
He talks a lot of old arse, doesn't he, Pete Waterman?
Oh, I sort of quite like him though.
Oh, I dunno, I find him irritating.
Well, yeah...
It's like he genuinely thinks he's up there with Lennon and McCartney, as one of the great kind of... pop svengalis of his time.
Yeah.
And, you know, you...
Steve sighs
I dunno, he wrote songs for Sinitta.
Well...
Don't bring that back.
Don't... let's not... let's not knock 'em, there's... Foxy's on there.
True, no no, Dr Fox is a genius.

... keeping up on the news, what's going on there.
Ricky and Steve laugh
And uh... they did a...
Trunky News!
They did a thing about him and what he'd look like if his head wasn't messed up.
Yeah.
Yeah.
And they made a little picture for him.
Was he quite good-looking?
Not bad-looking, but he can't use it. It's not like... he can't... he can't put it on a passport.
Sure.
Yeah. Well, and the fact that he's been dead for several years.
Yeah.
No, but they also do that sort of thing for people who are alive. They say "this is what you'd look like".
So you can't use it for that.
Yeah.
You can't use it on like...
Isn't that like... that's sort of like rubbing it in though, innit really?
It is a bit. Yeah.
Yeah. Unless they said "good news - you were ugly anyway".
Steve laughs
Yeah.
To be quite honest...
You wouldn't have pulled even if you didn't look like an elephant.
... if you were symmetrical, you weren't a looker.
Steve laughs
You couldn't use it on a little dating agency picture. "This is what I look like".
Yeah.
Yeah, and then they turn up on the day...
"This is what I would've looked like", and they phone up and go "I'm intrigued, what do you mean 'would've looked like?'" "Well I'll see you, as we said, 7 o'clock." "How will I recognise you?" ...
... "I'll be eating buns."
Yeah. "Look for the giant cauliflower".
Ricky laughs
Yeah! In a coat.
Exactly.
I love the fact that you're keeping up... keeping up to date with what the Elephant Man might've looked like.
Steve laughs
Yeah, exactly.
That is amazing.
Karl's news is largely what's happening in around 1880.
Yeah, or what might've happened around 1880.
Exactly, yeah. Yeah.
No, but it's sad though. Did you watch that thing in the week, that 'What Are You Staring At?' programme?
I didn't, no, I couldn't face it. I know what you mean, it was about people who'd had unfortunate deformities and stuff.
Yeah, yeah, and it was really sad. I suddenly felt bad about, you know, some of the stuff we've talked about and what have you, cause it...
Yeah.
Can I just say something, right? That's quite a nice thing to say, "oh, I suddenly felt bad about some of the things we've talked about". Shall we go over what we've discussed today?
What?
What subjects have we brought up today? How can you feel sorry about things like that when we're still doing it?
No, but I'm just saying, you know, you have a laugh and that, but then you see a program about it and you go "oh..."
What, you realise they're real people you're talking about?
Yeah.

When do you ever forget that? When do you ever forget, that when you bring up these Cheeky Freaks of the Weeks, or when we talk about Rik Waller, that he's... there's not a real person on the other end, thinking about it?
Yeah, but sometimes it's hard 'cause they don't look like real people.
Ricky explodes with laughter
Play a record!
Don't slag off Rik Waller.
Ricky laughs
That girl was on with the big head...
Ricky wheezes
... was like Bo' Selecta!
Credit to the Nation - Teenage Sensation
We played some... Dizzee Rascal earlier, and...
And that was wicked!
Exactly, and he's the new kind of, uh... the kind of London rap sensation...
Yeah, yeah.
... but let's not forget Credit to the Nation from 1994 - Teenage Sensation...
They're from Birmingham though, Steve.
Whatever happened to MC Fusion? He got a lot of bad press at the time, people didn't respect him, but I'm listening to that now, I think it was bloody brilliant.
Yeah.
Alright?
And crucial and that.
Steve laughs
Exactly. Adverts.
Ricky sniggers
Adverts
Kings of Leon - Molly's Chambers...
... on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, you're Stephen Merchant and that little... little bald head mank over there is Karl Pilkington.
Cock-a-leekie soup?
Cock-a-leekie soup is fine.
That was one from Nick - thanks for that, Nick.
Yeah.
Is it Nob News?
Of course, referring to the woman who chewed on a nob in a goulash.
Exactly.
People...
If you've just tuned in, you've missed that hilarious story.
Yeah. We still don't know why she was eating goulash. I've got a rash, look, coming up my arm, look at that.
Brilliant. Fascinating. Thanks for that.
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
Infantile giggling,
Okay.
Like two school boys.
Right.
Alright, we're gonna come back, we're gonna have some quality monkey news next week. We're gonna have all kinds of treats, I would think.
Okay.
Some great prizes. All right? All okay?
Yeah, yeah, let's show 'em, let's make next week the best show ever.

Good luck. If you miss it. Then you miss out. We're ending with the track from a couple years back. I think it was '92, '93, Dinosaur Jr, Start Choppin, play that. Start playing. Forget start chopping, start playing.
Dinosaur Jr - Start Choppin'
Alright.
Alright.
See you next week.
Yeah..

synopsis.description: Karl doesn't splash out on a lady.
Ricky gets a broken tap for Christmas.
Ricky turns into Alan Partridge trying to explain how a fridge works.
Karl has an interesting fact about digging a big hole in the Earth.
Karl doesn't care about quantum physics.
